subject: Medicine
title: Semmelweis and Handwashing
description: A 60-second lesson on Semmelweis and Handwashing.

hook.text: Women in one maternity ward died at five times the rate of the ward next door. Nobody knew why.

buildup.text: Ignaz Semmelweis noticed that doctors came straight from autopsies to deliver babiesâ€”without washing.

discovery.text: When he made doctors wash hands in chlorine solution, the death rate dropped from 18% to under 2%.

twist.text: Doctors were outraged. They refused to believe their own hands could be killing patients.

climax.text: Semmelweis was ridiculed, fired, and died in an asylum. He was proven right decades later.

punchline.text: The cure was soap. The barrier was ego.

quiz.question: Why did doctors reject Semmelweis's handwashing discovery?
options: They refused to believe their hands were killing patients
The death rate didn't actually change
Chlorine was too expensive to use regularly
